body: Currently we only have one setting, but this can easily be expanded for a number of things such as auto-accepting file transfers, auto-logging, custom nicknames, message notifications etc. - - - This change isâ€‚[](https://reviewable.io/reviews/TokTok/toxic/277)

comment_data.body: `strcasecmp()` is a posix function. It is not part of the C standard.
this will fail if the folder does not exist.
looks like config values for public keys start with "pk_". Either document and/or add a "pk_" prefix check to make it explicit.
Perhaps, but we've been using it in Toxic for 10+ years and I'm not about to re-implement it in this PR.

The `pk_` prefix is documented in the example config file. Technically any three-char prefix will work, but we're not going to tell the user that since it just makes it more confusing. The main issue is that libconfig keys can't start with numbers, so it has to be prefixed with _something_.
The config directory is created in main() via `init_default_data_files()`
On second thought, I guess we should do an explicit check to prevent any potential undocumented behaviour.

commit.message:
feat: add support for friend config settings

Currently we only have one setting, but this can easily be
expanded for a number of things such as auto-accepting file
transfers, auto-logging, custom nicknames, message notifications
etc.
